isis.stitle: TRW MANUAL STEERING GEAR - ADJUSTMENTS - WORMING BEARING PRELOAD

step1.para: Slowly rotate input shaft to end of travel in either direction. Back off 1/4 of a rotation and note backlash condition. There should be play (no contact) between output rollershaft "roller" and input shaft "worm" gear teeth.

Measure the worm bearing preload by placing an in-lb. (Nm) torque wrench on the input shaft. Torque required to rotate input shaft back and forth (oscillate) through 1/4 rotation at this (no roller contact) lash position is:

item.para: Without input shaft (column) seal - 7 to 14 in-lbs. (0.8 to 1.6 Nm).
With input shaft (column) seal - 9 to 16 in-lbs. (1.0 to 1.8 Nm).

note.para: Integral long input shaft/steering wheel column type steering gears may not have input shaft (column) seal.

svcsubproc.title: Procedure for Correcting Worm Bearing Preload

step1.para: Remove worm cover and input shaft seal if it is in worm cover. Discard seal.

Remove shim pack and eliminate one shim at a time from the shim pack [normally a .002 inch (.05 mm) shim] to increase preload. The size of shim to remove depends on the amount of lash detected. Do not remove .0075 inch (.191 mm) rubber-coated steel shims to adjust bearing preload.

note.para: The shims may be in five sizes: .002 inch (0.05 mm), .003 inch (0.08 mm), .005 inch (0.13 mm), .0075 inch (0.191 mm), .010 inch (0.25 mm), made of steel, paper, or rubber-coated steel.

step1.para: Assemble worm cover, shims and worm cover bolts finger tight. Rubber-covered shims (if applicable) must be assembled with the rubber-coated side against the housing and worm cover.
Assemble new input shaft seal if seal was removed with worm cover.

note.para: Be sure you have just a beginning (light) preload with cover bolts finger tight before tightening cover bolts to specification.

step1.para: Tighten worm cover bolts to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (61 to 75 Nm).
Recheck preload. Repeat procedure with a different selection of shims if necessary.
